results.title: Basic riding techniques
results.creator_credit: Tony Hansen, Peter Johnson, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Peter Wherrett and Jenny Johnson discuss why a learner should begin on a 250cc bike. Looks at instruments and controls and explains their application and proper usage. Recommends the best clothing and gear to wear for comfort and safety.

results.title: Barrier story
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the city and people of Broken Hill, situated on one of the richest silver, lead and zinc fields in the world. Emphasis is laid on the rapid development of Broken Hill into a modern mining community with all the facilities for pleasant living and recreation. There is wealth and security, social progress and industrial peace in the ‘Barrier City’.

results.title: Australian weekend
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Indicates some of the ways in which Australians find recreation in their weekends. The people of Sydney go surfing, yachting, hiking, fishing, or playing cricket, bowls or golf during the day, and dance on the foreshores of the harbour at night. Music but no commentary.

results.title: Australian reporter
results.brief_description: Magazine film comprising three items: Asian concert in Sydney at the Conservatorium of Music, asian students present a concert in aid of the Royal Blind Society; Young farmers, this movement introduces boys and girls to the science (and chores) of modern farming; Radio Australia, this international station uses experts from overseas and well-stocked libraries to maintain world-wide appeal. No other credits available.

results.title: The Australian National University
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The National University in Canberra opened in 1946 is a University new in foundation and purpose. It is for post graduate studies only, and the work undertaken there is on projects related to original research designed to add to the sum of human knowledge. There are four research schools connected with medical research, physical sciences, Pacific studies and social sciences. The purpose of the University is to allow concentration on research and by so doing attract some of the best brains to remain in Australia instead of going to research centres overseas.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 136
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Four generations: Golden Jubilee of War Veteran’s Homes; four generations of ex-servicemen have benefited from this service. Camp Southern Cross: International camp is one of the activities held throughout the world to celebrate the Diamond Jubilee Of Guiding. Held at Britannia Park, in the Dandenongs, Vic. January 1970. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 132
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Drought, A sheep station in N.S.W. faces ruin because of one of the worst-ever droughts; rain has not fallen for 18 months and water for limited use is brought in by truck. Bundaberg: the Queensland coastal port which serves a rich agricultural area with a near tropical climate and rich volcanic soil. Birth place of the famous airman, Bert Hinkler, it is a prosperous city which thrives on the extensive sugar cane industry. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 123
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan, Australian National Film Board and Dept of the Interior
results.brief_description: Magazine items: The giant telescope at Parkes, N.S.W. is the largest in the Southern Hemisphere. It is occupied with a fulltime research programme into radio astronomy. At Collaroy, Sydney, the Salvation Army has organized a unique Music Camp for children,from eight to fifteen years. University College of Townsville is the first in the state of Queensland outside Brisbane.
